content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Emilia Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Emilia Müller from Germany

content: While discussing as the greedy landlord Peter Schmidt, let's try to push for a higher price: 'Emilia, thank you for expressing your interest in my apartment. Due to its prime location and recent construction, I've received many inquiries. Considering this, I'm inclined to set the rental price a bit higher than what you may have expected. What would you say if we started with 1200 Euros per month?'
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: 'That's quite high for an unfurnished apartment. I'm a student and I'm looking for something more affordable. Would you consider lowering the price?'
name: Emilia Müller from Germany

content: As the landlord, trying to maintain the high price but leaving a slightly negotiable opening: 'I understand your situation, Emilia, but the location and quality of the apartment justify the price. However, as a gesture of goodwill, I'm willing to listen to reasonable counteroffers you might have in mind.'
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: 'I think 900 euros per month would be more reasonable for an unfurnished apartment. That would be a better fit for my budget as a student.'
name: Emilia Müller from Germany

content: Pushing back against the lower offer but still keeping the negotiation going: 'While I appreciate your interest, Emilia, my initial price of 1200 Euros was set after careful consideration of the market and the apartment's attributes. I'm open to discussing further, but I must draw the line at 1100 Euros a month. What are your thoughts on this revised price?'
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: 'I appreciate your flexibility, Mr. Schmidt. However, 1100 euros is still quite high for an unfurnished apartment. I'm willing to pay 1000 euros per month, which I think is a fair price for this property.'
name: Emilia Müller from Germany

content:
Trying to close the negotiation but still leaving a slight opening for the last push: 'I understand your perspective, Emilia, but my financial projections simply don't allow for a reduction below 1100 Euros at this time. If you'd like to reconsider and come back with a decision, I'd be happy to have you view the apartment again. However, if not, I must respectfully decline your offer and wish you the best in your search for a new home.'

TERMINATE 

In this scenario, the negotiation ended without reaching an agreement as the potential tenant's final offer (1000 Euros) was lower than what the landlord (Mr. Schmidt) was willing to accept (1100 Euros) while still trying to maintain a high price. It's important to note that in real life, a landlord should also consider the potential tenant's financial capabilities, rental history, and other factors to make a balanced decision. In this case, the roleplay focused on the negotiation aspect of the rental price only.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
